com.labyrinthdash

Class Vector2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.labyrinthdash.Vector2D

  • public class Vector2D
extends java.lang.Object
    Vector2D provides a structure for points and vectors and is a fundamental class in the physics of Labyrinth Dash. It provides a host of methods for manipulating vectors and comparing them.

    A single class can be used for points and vectors as point can simply be represented as a vector from the origin in a specific direction.

    It is important to note that none of the functions in this class modify the values of the class. Rather each function returns a new vector where appropriate.

    Author:
    Isaac Doub

      • distance

        public double distance(Vector2D vector)
        Returns the scalar distance between two vectors as a double. This makes more sense when the class is representing points than vectors but can also be applicaple for vectors.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to find the distance to
        Returns:
        The distance between vectors as double

      • dot

        Returns the scalar dot product of two vectors as a double.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to be dotted with.
        Returns:
        The dot product as a double

      • cross

        public double cross(Vector2D vector)
        Returns the vector cross product of two vectors as a double calculated using the 'determinant' rule. The vector cross product is not defined for 2D space. In this case it is a representation of the orientation of one vector against another, similar to the dot product.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to be crossed with.
        Returns:
        The corss product as a double
